quote-text: [..] prior to 1886, dating back to the 1600s, corporations were viewed as âartificial persons,â a legal turn of phrase that offered certain rights to the companies but without the full rights of citizens. By using the wording of the 14th Amendment (intended to protect former slaves from a state government seeking to âdeprive any person of life, liberty, or property, without due process of lawâ) it was ruled that corporations should enjoy the same status.
